location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 245 of 1850 from Lieutenant-Colonel Samuel Hennell, Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter relates to the slave trade on the Arab coast of the Persian Gulf, and contains a translated copy of a letter received from the Native Agent at Sharjah, Moollah Houssein [Mullā Husayn], dated 29 May 1850, reporting a marked increase in the slave trade to the Persian Gulf from Zanzibar and Berberah [Berbera]. The Sharjah Agent's letter discusses the movements and actions of the region's inhabitants, with particular reference to vessels from Rusel Khymah [Ra's al-Khaymah] that touch down at Sohar [Ṣuḥār] and along the Batinah [Al-Bāṭinah] coast with slaves brought from the African coast.
